author: adityapatwardhan
body:
The change adds Compress-TestContent cmdlet to build.psm1 so that it can
compress the powershell test content. This is done only for daily builds.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: `Compress-TestContent` is very specific to the daily builds scenario. I think it's better to move it to appveyor.psm1 as well.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body:
@vors The reason to have Compress-TestContent in build.psm1 was to have easy access to the 'test' folder using $PSScriptRoot\test\powershell. If we move this to appveyor.psm1 I would have to reference the folder using $PSScriptRoot..\test\powershell. Also no functions in appveryor.psm1 have a reference to the src code, they only use the built binaries. 

I am fine either ways, let me know what you think.

title: Add archive with test content to AppVeyor artifacts for daily builds.
